intro: Eremogone dianthoides subsp. tuncbasii, commonly known as the Tuncbasi's eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. It is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native region. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on xerophytic plants.
